formula: a(n) = product_{j=n..n+4} prime(j). - _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Jan 07 2015
mathematica: lst={};Do[p0=Prime[n];p1=Prime[n+1];p2=Prime[n+2];p3=Prime[n+3];p4=Prime[n+4];a=p0*p1*p2*p3*p4;AppendTo[lst,a],{n,5!}];lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Mar 10 2009 *)Times@@@Partition[Prime[Range[200]],5,1] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Oct 21 2011 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [&*[ NthPrime(n+k): k in [0..4] ]: n in [1..22]];  // _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 25 2011
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Jun 15 1998
